column4: yeah thats your public IP, your network has a NAT layer between it and the world that handles the local 10.0.x.x subnet
do people  see 10.0.x.x or 85.100.y.y from remote ?
the 10.0.x.x. is a public IP class (one of three) that allows for private networks to not use the public IP space
always the 85.100.y.y
what command to see from terminal 85.100.y.y , because i cant see by ifconfig
if the tried to get to the 10.0 address, they'd get blocked by 90% of big iron routers, as they block PFC addressing to keep certain attacks at bay
try traceroute www.google.com
i know traceroute, but i ask the command in ubuntu, it is tracert in xp
it should say something like ***** 10.0.0.1 , then ***** 85.100.X.X as it traces your route from your PC to google
its "traceroute"
you have a broswer available?
yes i have firefox
you can also google for "What is my IP" and click (make sure you follow the link) to see what your public IP is...
if I wasn't stuck in a terminal with BitchX IRC, I would just check in the client to see your IP :\
it says comman not found for traceroute ??
so it does, try tracepath
tab complete is a blessing
just google for "what is my IP"
i know google thing, just trying to learn from terminal
eh ok well then yeah traceroute6 should be cool
tracepath is ok too:)
need to check it out myself :)
another good way from term is just to ssh into a remote box, it'll tell you what your public IP is either with "who" or at the system prompt
